profile.title: Profile
profile.notLoggedIn: Please Sign Up / Login to shop online aroundYou
profile.name: Name
profile.logoutConfirm: Are you sure you want to logout?
profile.logoutFailed: Failed to logout. Please try again.
profile.switchMessage: Are you sure you want to switch to consumer mode?
profile.privacyIntroductionText: Welcome to Around You. We are committed to protecting your privacy and ensuring that your personal information is handled securely and responsibly. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you use our mobile application and services.
profile.privacyPersonalInfo: Personal Information: Name, email, phone number, delivery addresses
profile.privacyOrderInfo: Order Information: Order details, payment information, transaction records
profile.privacyLocationInfo: Location Data: To show available shops, validate delivery zones, and calculate delivery fees
profile.privacyDeviceInfo: Device Information: Device identifiers, app usage data
profile.privacyMerchantAccountInfo: Merchant Account Information: Shop details, verification documents, business information
profile.privacyShopInfo: Shop Information: Shop locations, inventory, delivery zones, operating hours
profile.privacyOrderData: Order Data: Customer orders, delivery information, payment records
profile.privacyCustomerData: Customer Information: Shared with you for order fulfillment (names, addresses, contact details)
profile.privacyUseOrderProcessing: Order Processing: To process, fulfill, and deliver your orders
profile.privacyUseCommunication: Communication: To send order confirmations, status updates, and delivery notifications
profile.privacyUsePersonalization: Personalization: To personalize content and recommendations based on your preferences
profile.privacyUseLocation: Location Services: To show available shops, validate delivery zones, and calculate delivery fees
profile.privacyUseShopManagement: Shop Management: To manage your shops, inventory, and delivery settings
profile.privacyUseOrderFulfillment: Order Fulfillment: To process and fulfill customer orders
profile.privacyUseCustomerSharing: Customer Information Sharing: We share customer delivery information with you and your riders for order fulfillment
profile.privacyUseAnalytics: Analytics: To provide insights into your shop performance and customer behavior
profile.privacySharingWithMerchants: When you place an order, we share your order details, delivery address, and contact information with the merchant you order from. The merchant may share this information with their riders to complete the delivery.
profile.privacySharingNote: Note: Merchants and their riders are independent entities. We are not responsible for how merchants or their riders handle your information.
profile.privacyMerchantSharing: We share customer information (order details, delivery addresses, contact information) with you and your designated riders for order fulfillment. You are responsible for handling this information in accordance with applicable privacy laws.
profile.privacyMerchantResponsibility: As a merchant, you should have your own privacy policies or data handling practices that comply with applicable laws when processing customer data.
profile.privacyRightAccess: Access: You can access and review your personal information through the app
profile.privacyRightCorrection: Correction: You can update or correct inaccurate information at any time
profile.privacyRightDeletion: Deletion: You can request deletion of your account and associated data
profile.privacyRightOptOut: Opt-Out: You can opt-out of promotional communications
profile.privacyDataSecurityText: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal information, including encryption, access controls, and secure storage. However, no method of transmission over the internet is 100% secure.
profile.privacyContactText: If you have any questions, concerns, or requests regarding this Privacy Policy or our data practices, please contact us at ar162387@gmail.com
profile.privacyFullPolicyMessage: This is a summary of key privacy information. For the complete privacy policy including all sections, terms, and legal details, please read the full document:
profile.feedbackSubmitted: Thank you for your feedback! We will review it soon.
profile.feedbackError: Failed to submit. Please try again or contact us directly at ar162387@gmail.com
profile.deleteAccountSubtitle: Permanently delete your account and data
profile.deleteAccountWarningMessage: Deleting your account will permanently remove all your data. This cannot be undone.
profile.deleteAccountMerchantPrerequisite: You must delete all {{count}} shop(s) before you can delete your account.
profile.deleteAccountConsumerPrerequisite: You must delete your merchant account before you can delete your consumer account.
profile.deleteAccountInfo: Your user account and profile information
profile.retainTransactionRecords: Transaction records (for legal compliance, typically 7 years)
profile.completeDeletionMessage: For complete account deletion including transaction records, please submit a formal request:
profile.deleteAccountConfirmMessage: Are you sure you want to delete your account? This action cannot be undone.
profile.deleteAccountSuccessMessage: Your merchant account has been deleted successfully.
profile.deleteAccountConsumerMessage: Your merchant account has been deleted. To completely delete your consumer account and all associated data, please submit a formal deletion request using the link provided in the deletion modal.
profile.deleteAccountError: Failed to delete account. Please try again.
profile.suggestionComplaintSubtitle: Share your feedback, suggestions, or complaints with us
profile.feedbackNote: Your feedback helps us improve our service. We appreciate your time and will review your message soon.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about using the merchant platform

account.title: Account & Verification
account.q1: How do I create a merchant account?
account.a1: To create a merchant account, go to your profile and select 'Switch to Merchant'. You'll be asked to complete a registration survey about your shop type and number of shops. After completing the survey, you can start creating your first shop.
account.q2: Why do I need to verify my identity?
account.a2: Identity verification is required to ensure the security and trustworthiness of our platform. Your shops will not be visible to customers until your identity is verified. You need to submit your CNIC details (name as per CNIC, CNIC number, and expiry date) for verification.
account.a3: Verification typically takes 1-3 business days. Once submitted, your status will show as 'Pending'. You'll be notified when your verification is approved and your shops become visible to customers.
account.q4: What if my verification is rejected?
account.a4: If your verification is rejected, you'll receive a notification with the reason. You can update your information and resubmit the verification form. Make sure all CNIC details match exactly as they appear on your identity document.
account.q5: Can I switch between merchant and consumer modes?
account.a5: Yes, you can switch between merchant and consumer modes at any time from your profile. You can also set one mode as your default so the app opens in that mode automatically.

shop.title: Shop Management
shop.q1: How do I create a shop?
shop.a1: After completing merchant registration, go to the 'Shops' tab in your merchant dashboard and tap 'Create New Shop'. You'll need to provide shop name, description, type, address (select on map), and optionally add tags and a shop picture. Once created, you can manage inventory, delivery settings, and opening hours.
shop.q2: How many shops can I create?
shop.a2: You can create multiple shops under one merchant account. The number of shops you indicated during registration doesn't limit you - you can add more shops as needed. Each shop has its own inventory, delivery areas, and settings.
shop.q3: How do I edit my shop information?
shop.a3: Go to your shop portal and tap the 'Settings' tab. From there, you can edit shop name, description, type, address, tags, and picture. Changes are saved immediately and will be visible to customers.
shop.a4: Yes, you can delete a shop from the Settings tab in your shop portal. Note that deleting a shop will remove all associated data including inventory, delivery settings, and order history references. This action cannot be undone.
shop.q5: What are shop tags and how do they help?
shop.a5: Shop tags are keywords that help customers find your shop when searching. Examples include specialties, popular items, or unique features. Tags improve your shop's discoverability in search results.
shop.q6: Why is my shop not visible to customers?
shop.a6: Your shop may not be visible if: (1) Your merchant account verification is still pending or not verified, (2) Your shop is closed (check opening hours), (3) No delivery areas are set up, or (4) Your shop has no active inventory items. Check these settings in your shop portal.

inventory.title: Inventory Management
inventory.q1: How do I add items to my inventory?
inventory.a1: Go to your shop portal and select the 'Inventory' tab. Tap 'Add New Item' to create a custom item, or 'Choose from Template' to use pre-filled item templates. For custom items, you'll need to enter name, SKU, price, and assign categories. Template items have names and descriptions pre-filled but you set the price and SKU.
inventory.q2: What is the difference between custom items and template items?
inventory.a2: Custom items are created entirely by you - you control name, description, SKU, price, and image. Template items are based on a shared catalog where name, barcode, and description are managed centrally. For template items, you only set the price and SKU. Template items help maintain consistency across shops.
inventory.q3: How do I organize items into categories?
inventory.a3: First, create categories in the 'Categories' tab. You can create custom categories or choose from category templates. Then, when creating or editing an item, assign it to one or more categories. Items can belong to multiple categories for better organization.
inventory.q4: Can I change the price of an item?
inventory.a4: Yes, you can edit item prices at any time. Go to the Inventory tab, find the item, and tap to edit. Price changes are logged in the audit log for transparency. Note that template items allow price changes, but name and description are locked.
inventory.a5: Active items are visible to customers and can be ordered. Inactive items are hidden from customers but remain in your inventory. You can toggle item status to temporarily hide items without deleting them. Inactive items require a SKU to be reactivated.
inventory.a6: The audit log tracks all changes to your inventory items including price updates, status changes, SKU edits, and template syncs. It shows who made the change, when, and what changed. This helps maintain transparency and track inventory history.

orders.title: Order Management
orders.q1: How do I see new orders?
orders.a1: New orders appear in the 'Orders' tab of your merchant dashboard. Orders are grouped by time period (Today, Yesterday, Last 7 Days, etc.). Pending orders that need confirmation are highlighted. You can tap any order to see full details.
orders.q2: What should I do when I receive a new order?
orders.a2: When you receive a new order: (1) Review the order details including items, customer address, and special instructions, (2) Confirm the order if you can fulfill it, (3) Prepare the items, (4) Assign a delivery runner, and (5) Mark as delivered when complete. You can cancel orders if items are out of stock or for other valid reasons.
orders.q3: How do I assign a delivery runner?
orders.a3: After confirming an order, tap 'Assign Runner'. You'll see all delivery runners for your shop with their current status (Free or Delivering). Select an available runner or queue the order to a busy runner. The runner will be notified and can see order details including customer address.
orders.a4: Yes, you can cancel orders at any stage (pending, confirmed, or out for delivery). Select a cancellation reason such as 'Out of Stock' or 'Other Reason'. The customer will be notified of the cancellation. Use cancellation only when necessary as it affects customer experience.
orders.q5: How do I track order analytics?
orders.a5: Order analytics are available in your shop portal's 'Dashboard' tab. You can see total orders, revenue, average order value, confirmation time, preparation time, delivery time, and status breakdown. Filter by time period to analyze performance over different periods.
orders.q6: What if a customer wants to modify or cancel their order?
orders.a6: Currently, customers can cancel their own orders. If a customer contacts you to modify an order, you may need to cancel the existing order and ask them to place a new one. We're working on order modification features for the future.

delivery.title: Delivery Management
delivery.q1: How do I set up delivery areas?
delivery.a1: Go to your shop portal, select 'Delivery' tab, and tap 'Manage' under Delivery Areas. On the map, tap 'Add delivery area' and drop at least 3 points to form a polygon around your service area. You can create multiple delivery zones. Customers only see your shop if their address is within these zones.
delivery.a2: No, delivery zones cannot overlap. Each zone must have clear boundaries. If you try to create overlapping zones, you'll get an error. Adjust the zone boundaries to ensure they don't overlap.
delivery.q3: How do I add delivery runners?
delivery.a3: In the Delivery tab of your shop portal, go to 'Delivery Runners' and tap 'Add'. Enter the runner's name and phone number. You can add multiple runners. Runners will see orders assigned to them with customer details and delivery addresses.
delivery.q4: What is delivery logic and how does it work?
delivery.a4: Delivery logic controls order value thresholds and fees. You can set: (1) Minimum order value - orders below this get a surcharge, (2) Small order surcharge - fee added to small orders, (3) Least order value - hard floor below which orders are rejected, (4) Free delivery threshold - order value and distance criteria for free delivery. These settings help manage delivery costs and encourage larger orders.
delivery.a5: Distance tiering calculates delivery fees based on distance from your shop. You can use 'Auto Mode' with default tiers, or 'Custom Mode' to set your own distance-based pricing. Beyond the last tier, linear scaling applies (e.g., +Rs 10 per 250m). You can also set a maximum delivery fee cap.
delivery.q6: How is delivery fee calculated for customers?
delivery.a6: Delivery fee is calculated based on: (1) Distance from shop to customer address, (2) Order value (small orders may have surcharge), (3) Distance tiering settings, (4) Free delivery eligibility (if order value and distance meet criteria). The system automatically calculates and displays the fee at checkout.

openingHours.title: Opening Hours & Availability
openingHours.q1: How do I set my shop's opening hours?
openingHours.a1: Go to your shop portal, select 'Settings' tab, and tap 'Opening Hours'. Set the days and times when your shop accepts orders. You can set different hours for each day of the week. The system will automatically show your shop as open or closed based on the schedule.
openingHours.q2: Can I manually override the open/closed status?
openingHours.a2: Yes, you can set the open status mode to 'Force Open' or 'Force Closed' to manually override the schedule. This is useful for holidays, special events, or unexpected closures. The manual setting takes priority over the schedule.
openingHours.a3: In the Opening Hours section, scroll to 'Custom Holidays' and tap 'Add a holiday'. Select a date and add a short description (2-6 words, e.g., 'Eid Holiday'). On holidays, your shop will stay closed even if the schedule says open. You can remove holidays anytime.
openingHours.q4: What happens to orders when my shop is closed?
openingHours.a4: When your shop is closed, customers cannot place new orders. Your shop will not appear in search results or shop listings. Existing orders that are already confirmed or out for delivery will continue to be processed. Make sure to update your status if you need to close unexpectedly.

payments.title: Payments & Revenue
payments.q1: How do I receive payments from customers?
payments.a1: Currently, the platform supports Cash on Delivery (COD). Customers pay with cash when the order is delivered. You collect payment directly from the customer or delivery runner. Card payments and mobile wallet options (JazzCash, Easypaisa) are coming soon.
payments.q2: How can I track my revenue?
payments.a2: Revenue tracking is available in your shop portal's 'Dashboard' tab. You can see total revenue, average order value, and revenue trends over different time periods. Filter by Today, Yesterday, Last 7 Days, Last 30 Days, or All Time to analyze performance.
payments.q3: Are there any platform fees or commissions?
payments.a3: Please refer to your merchant agreement for details about platform fees. Currently, merchants handle payments directly with customers via Cash on Delivery. For future payment methods, fee structures will be communicated in advance.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.q1: My shop is not appearing in search results. What's wrong?
troubleshooting.a1: Check these common issues: (1) Verify your merchant account is verified (not pending), (2) Ensure your shop has delivery areas set up, (3) Check that you have active inventory items, (4) Verify your shop is set to 'Open' status, (5) Make sure the customer's address is within your delivery zones. Fix any of these issues and your shop should appear.
troubleshooting.q2: I can't assign a delivery runner. What should I do?
troubleshooting.a2: Make sure you have added at least one delivery runner in your shop's Delivery settings. If runners show as 'Delivering', you can still queue orders to them. If no runners appear, go to Delivery tab and add runners with their name and phone number.
troubleshooting.q3: Orders are not showing up. What could be the issue?
troubleshooting.a3: Try these steps: (1) Pull down to refresh the orders list, (2) Check your internet connection, (3) Verify you're logged in with the correct account, (4) Make sure you're viewing the correct shop if you have multiple shops, (5) Check the time filter - switch between Today, Yesterday, etc. If issues persist, try logging out and back in.
troubleshooting.q4: How do I contact support if I need help?
troubleshooting.a4: You can contact support through the 'Suggestion or Complaint' option in your profile. Describe your issue in detail and our team will get back to you. For urgent matters, you can also email us at ar162387@gmail.com. We aim to respond within 24-48 hours.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about shopping on AroundYou

account.title: Account & Profile
account.q1: How do I create an account?
account.a1: To create an account, tap 'Sign Up / Login' from the home screen or profile. You can sign up with your email address. After creating an account, you can save addresses, track orders, and manage your shopping preferences.
account.q2: Can I use the app without creating an account?
account.a2: You can browse shops and view items without an account, but you'll need to create an account to place orders, save addresses, and track your order history. Creating an account is free and takes just a few moments.
account.q3: How do I update my profile information?
account.a3: Go to your Profile tab and you'll see your name and email. Currently, profile information is managed through your account settings. If you need to change your email or other details, you may need to contact support.
account.q4: Can I switch between consumer and merchant modes?
account.a4: Yes, if you have both a consumer account and a merchant account, you can switch between modes from your profile. Go to Profile → Settings and tap 'Switch to Merchant' or 'Switch to Consumer'. You can also set one mode as your default.

shopping.title: Finding Shops & Shopping
shopping.q1: How do I find shops near me?
shopping.a1: Shops are automatically shown based on your selected delivery address. Make sure you've selected a delivery address (tap the address bar at the top of the home screen). The app will show all shops that deliver to your location. You can filter by shop type (Grocery, Meat, Vegetable, etc.) or search for specific items.
shopping.q2: Why don't I see any shops?
shopping.a2: If you don't see shops, check: (1) Have you selected a delivery address? Tap the address bar to set your location, (2) Is your address within a shop's delivery zone? Some shops only deliver to specific areas, (3) Are shops open? Closed shops won't appear in results. Try selecting a different address or checking back during shop hours.
shopping.q3: How do I search for specific items?
shopping.a3: You can search for items in two ways: (1) From the home screen, use the search bar to find items across all shops, (2) When viewing a shop, tap the search icon to search within that shop's inventory. Search results show items with prices and you can add them directly to your cart.
shopping.q4: What information do I see about each shop?
shopping.a4: Each shop card shows: shop name, image, shop type, delivery fee (or 'Free delivery'), minimum order value, number of orders served, and whether the shop is currently open or closed. Tap on a shop to see full details, browse categories, and view all available items.
shopping.q5: How do I browse items in a shop?
shopping.a5: Tap on any shop to open the shop screen. Items are organized by categories. You can browse categories, tap to see all items in a category, or use the search icon to find specific items. Each item shows name, price, and description. Tap the '+' button to add items to your cart.
shopping.q6: Can I see shop ratings or reviews?
shopping.a6: Currently, the app shows the number of orders served by each shop. Rating and review features are coming soon. You can see shop details, delivery information, and order history to help you make decisions.

cart.title: Shopping Cart
cart.a1: Each shop has its own separate cart. When you add items from a shop, they go into that shop's cart. You can have multiple carts for different shops. To view all your carts, go to Profile → Addresses (or tap the cart icon). From there, you can manage carts, add more items, or proceed to checkout.
cart.q2: Can I save items in my cart for later?
cart.a2: Yes! Your cart is automatically saved and persists even if you close the app. Items remain in your cart until you place an order, delete the cart, or the shop removes items from inventory. You can come back anytime to complete your purchase.
cart.q3: What happens if a shop closes or an item becomes unavailable?
cart.a3: If a shop closes, you won't be able to checkout from that shop's cart until it reopens. If an item becomes unavailable (out of stock or removed), you'll see a notification when you try to checkout. You can remove unavailable items and continue with the rest of your order.
cart.q4: Can I edit quantities or remove items from my cart?
cart.a4: Yes, you can manage your cart items. In the cart view, you'll see '-' and '+' buttons to adjust quantities, or you can remove items entirely. Changes are saved automatically. You can also delete an entire shop's cart if needed.

orders.title: Placing & Tracking Orders
orders.q1: How do I place an order?
orders.a1: To place an order: (1) Add items to your cart from a shop, (2) Go to your carts (Profile → Addresses or cart icon), (3) Select the shop's cart you want to order from, (4) Review your items and select a delivery address, (5) Add any special instructions, (6) Review the order total (including delivery fee), and (7) Tap 'Place Order'. You'll receive a confirmation and can track your order in real-time.
orders.q2: What are the different order statuses?
orders.a2: Orders go through these statuses: (1) Pending Confirmation - waiting for shop to confirm, (2) Preparing Your Order - shop is preparing items, (3) Out for Delivery - order is on the way with a delivery runner, (4) Delivered - order completed, (5) Cancelled - order was cancelled. You can see the current status and track progress in real-time.
orders.q3: How do I track my order?
orders.a3: You can track orders in two ways: (1) Active orders show a banner at the top of the home screen - tap it to see full details, (2) Go to Profile → Orders to see all your orders. The order status screen shows real-time updates, delivery runner information, estimated delivery time, and order details.
orders.a4: Yes, you can cancel orders in certain statuses. You can cancel orders that are 'Pending Confirmation' or 'Preparing Your Order'. Once an order is 'Out for Delivery', cancellation may not be possible. To cancel, go to the order details screen and tap 'Cancel Order'. You'll be asked to confirm the cancellation.
orders.q5: What if I need to contact the shop or delivery runner?
orders.a5: When your order is 'Out for Delivery', you'll see the delivery runner's name and phone number on the order status screen. You can tap the 'Call' button to contact them directly. For shop-related questions, you can use the 'Suggestion or Complaint' feature in your profile to reach out.
orders.q6: How do I view my order history?
orders.a6: Go to Profile → Orders to see all your past and current orders. Orders are grouped by date (Today, Yesterday, etc.). Tap any order to see full details including items, delivery address, payment summary, and delivery time. You can also see completed delivery times for past orders.

addresses.title: Delivery Addresses
addresses.q1: How do I add a delivery address?
addresses.a1: To add an address: (1) Go to Profile → Addresses, (2) Tap 'Add New Address', (3) Search for your location or use your current location, (4) Pinpoint the exact delivery location on the map, (5) Add any additional details like flat/house number or landmark, (6) Optionally add a title (Home/Office), and (7) Save. You can add multiple addresses for different locations.
addresses.q2: Can I edit or delete saved addresses?
addresses.a2: Yes, you can manage your addresses. Go to Profile → Addresses to see all saved addresses. Tap on any address to edit it, or use the delete option to remove it. You can update the location, landmark, or other details anytime.
addresses.q3: What's the difference between 'Home' and 'Office' addresses?
addresses.a3: Home and Office are optional labels to help you organize your addresses. You can have one 'Home' address and one 'Office' address. These labels make it easier to identify addresses, but you can also save addresses without labels. The important part is the actual location on the map.
addresses.q4: Why is it important to pinpoint the exact location?
addresses.a4: Pinpointing the exact location helps delivery runners find you easily. Place the pin on your building entrance or the exact spot where you want delivery. This ensures smooth and accurate delivery. You can also add written details like 'Flat 2B' or 'Near Main Gate' to help the runner locate you.

delivery.title: Delivery & Fees
delivery.a1: Delivery fees are calculated based on: (1) Distance from the shop to your delivery address, (2) Order value (small orders may have a surcharge), (3) Shop's delivery pricing settings. The app automatically calculates and shows the delivery fee before you place an order. Some shops offer free delivery for orders above a certain value or within a certain distance.
delivery.q2: What is a minimum order value?
delivery.a2: Many shops have a minimum order value to ensure efficient delivery. If your order is below the minimum, you may see a small order surcharge added. Orders below the 'least order value' (hard floor) cannot be placed. The minimum order value is shown on each shop card and in the cart.
delivery.a3: Delivery time varies by shop and distance. Once your order is confirmed and a delivery runner is assigned, typical delivery times range from 30 minutes to 2 hours depending on distance, traffic, and preparation time. You can track your order in real-time to see when it's out for delivery and get updates.
delivery.q4: What if my address is outside a shop's delivery zone?
delivery.a4: If your selected address is outside a shop's delivery zone, you won't be able to place an order from that shop. The app will show a message indicating the address is outside the delivery zone. Try selecting a different address that's within the shop's service area, or look for other shops that deliver to your location.

payments.title: Payments
payments.a1: Currently, the app supports Cash on Delivery (COD). You pay with cash when your order arrives. Card payments and mobile wallet options (JazzCash, Easypaisa) are coming soon. When these options become available, you'll be able to pay online during checkout.
payments.q2: When do I pay for my order?
payments.a2: With Cash on Delivery, you pay when the delivery runner arrives with your order. Make sure you have the exact amount ready, or close to it, for a smooth transaction. The order total (including items, surcharges, and delivery fee) is shown before you place the order so you know exactly how much to pay.
payments.q3: What if I have payment issues?
payments.a3: If you have issues with payment, contact the delivery runner directly using the call button on the order status screen. For disputes or refunds, use the 'Suggestion or Complaint' feature in your profile to contact support. We'll help resolve payment-related issues promptly.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.q1: I can't see any shops. What should I do?
troubleshooting.a1: Try these steps: (1) Make sure you've selected a delivery address - tap the address bar at the top, (2) Check your internet connection, (3) Try selecting a different address - some areas may not have shops delivering, (4) Pull down to refresh the shop list, (5) Make sure location services are enabled. If issues persist, try restarting the app.
troubleshooting.q2: My order isn't showing up. What's wrong?
troubleshooting.a2: If your order isn't appearing: (1) Pull down to refresh the orders list, (2) Check your internet connection, (3) Make sure you're logged in with the correct account, (4) Check the 'Today' filter - switch between different time periods, (5) If you just placed an order, wait a moment and refresh. If issues persist, try logging out and back in.
troubleshooting.q3: I can't add items to my cart. What should I do?
troubleshooting.a3: If you can't add items: (1) Make sure you're logged in (some features require an account), (2) Check your internet connection, (3) Verify the shop is open (closed shops may restrict cart additions), (4) Try refreshing the shop page, (5) Make sure the item is in stock. If problems continue, try closing and reopening the app.
troubleshooting.a4: You can contact support through the 'Suggestion or Complaint' option in your profile. Describe your issue in detail and our team will get back to you. For urgent matters, you can also email us at ar162387@gmail.com. We aim to respond within 24-48 hours.
